title: Lionel Messi has no competition for the Ballon d'Or, Barcelona's Hristo Stoichkov claims
title_page: Lionel Messi has no competition for the Ballon d'Or, Barcelona's Hristo Stoichkov claims | Daily Mail Online
text:
Barcelona legend Hristo Stoichkov believes that Lionel Messi has no competition for the 2015 Ballon d'Or ahead of the ceremony on Monday night.
The Argentine superstar is the favourite to beat fellow nominees Cristiano Ronaldo and Neymar to the most coveted individual prize in world football.
Triumph for the 28-year-old in Switzerland will result in a record-breaking fifth title.
Barcelona and Argentina superstar Lionel Messi is favourite to win his fifth Ballon d'Or on Monday night
Hristo Stoichkov poses with the European Cup after Barcelona beat Sampdoria at Wembley in 1992
Speaking to Barca TV, former Barcelona favourite Stoichkov insisted that Messi's feats in the game have made him a 'myth'.
'Messi no longer competes with anyone, he is a myth,' the Bulgarian said.
'No one can doubt that Messi should win the Ballon d'Or. I think it's impossible that someone can overcome him.
'I doubt there will be another player like Messi.'
The Barcelona No 10 enjoyed a stellar 2015, inspiring Luis Enrique's side to five titles including La Liga, the Champions League, the Copa del Rey, the UEFA Super Cup and the Club World Cup.
Messi has been deadly alongside Luis Suarez and fellow Ballon d'Or nominee Neymar for Barcelona
Messi is poised to win his fifth Ballon d'Or trophy ahead of team-mate Neymar and rival Cristiano Ronaldo
